result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyrell D Richardson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use Dangerous Weapon (Misdemeanor)], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: *** 10-16-15, Judge Protasiewicz; THEREFORE, IT IS HEREBY ORDERED that the judgment of conviction shall be amended to reflect the correct penalty enhancer as sec. 939.63(1)(a), Stats. ***

miscConds.notes: Pay all costs and surcharges or, if not paid, convert to a civil judgment. Submit a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.
Enroll in a program and work towards obtaining a GED.
If the defendant successfully completes all conditions of probation, Court will grant expungement.

AODA assessment/treatment deemed appropriate.
Maintain absolute sobriety.

records.addlTxt:
Amending Judgment of Conviction, signed and filed.
     THEREFORE, IT IS HEREBY ORDERED that the judgment of conviction shall be amended to reflect the correct penalty enhancer as sec. 939.63(1)(a), Stats.
Per order of the Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to Hon. Janet C. Protasiewicz, Br. 24, for review. jbs
Letter from Department of Corrections seeking clarification of penalty enhancer statute.

Defendant Tyrell D Richardson in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

15RM029185  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
06/11/2015
Court ordered Defendant not to be in possession of any firearms or any dangerous weapons.
Oral No Contact Order with Janice W. or Tyrone R.

Defendant Tyrell D Richardson in court.  Ann R. Lopez appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Court reviewed the AMENDED complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br. 24  for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 6/15/15 @ 1:30pm
